item.title: Trump's sanctions on Iran have dramatically effected its economy and led to protests
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent admitted that Washington helped spark recent protests in Iran by creating a U.S. dollar shortage, leading to runaway inflation.

item.title: Ukraine enters fifth year with no end in sight
item.description: The war in Ukraine enters its fifth year this week, with millions of Ukrainians displaced, hundreds of thousands of soldiers killed, and little change on the battlefield.

item.title: BAFTAs apologize after guest with Tourette syndrome uses racial slur during ceremony
item.description: A man with Tourette syndrome shouted a racial slur and other offensive remarks during the BAFTA awards ceremony Sunday. The BBC did not edit out his outbursts in its delayed broadcast.

item.title: U.K. arrests ex-ambassador to the U.S. on suspicion of misconduct over Epstein ties
item.description: Police have arrested Peter Mandelson, a veteran Labour Party politician who served as British ambassador to the U.S., as part of an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: In the shadow of the Olympics, migrants search for a welcome in Milan
item.description: As Italy cracks down on migration, Milan takes a different path — offering shelter and integration to asylum seekers even as the central government tightens borders and funds deterrence abroad.

item.title: Trump to raise global tariffs. And, most say the state of the union is weak, poll says
item.description: President Trump says he is raising global tariffs to 15%. And ahead of the president's address tomorrow, most Americans say the state of the union is not strong, according to an NPR poll.

item.title: Death of Mexican cartel leader sparks widespread violence across Mexico
item.description: One of the world's most wanted drug traffickers -- a Mexican cartel boss known as "El Mencho" -- was killed by Mexican security forces. After his death, widespread violence erupted across Mexico.

item.title: Brits question whether age of deference is over after ex-Prince Andrew's arrest
item.description: After the arrest of the former Prince Andrew, British institutions from the media to Parliament are asking whether they should have scrutinized the royals more. Is an age of deference now over?

item.title: China urges White House to lift tariffs after Supreme Court ruling
item.description: China says it is making a "full assessment" of the U.S. Supreme Court's tariff ruling and urged Washington to lift "relevant unilateral tariff measures" on its trading partners.
